p: Phylogeographic studies indicated that the HA multi-basic cleavage site was estimated to have been inserted into an LPAI H7N9 lineage circulating in the Yangtze River Delta region around May 2016, which later went on to reassort with one of the other H7N9 clades in the Pearl Delta region and H9N2 [ 162]. As LPAI H7N9 can cause severe illness and death in people, it is unsurprising that HPAI also does, but it has been suggested that disease progression is more rapid for HPAI than LPAI infections [ 160]. Also of concern was the presence and ease of acquisition of E627 K or D701N mutations in PB2 in the human isolates, since, similarly to HPAI H5N1 cases, these are associated with increased virulence and adaptation in mammals [ 160, 163].
